org.apache.tamaya.spisupport.propertysource

Class SystemPropertySource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.tamaya.spisupport.propertysource.BasePropertySource
      • org.apache.tamaya.spisupport.propertysource.SystemPropertySource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertySource

    public class SystemPropertySource
extends BasePropertySource
    This PropertySource manages the system properties. You can disable this feature by setting tamaya.envprops.disable or tamaya.defaults.disable.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Description copied from interface: PropertySource
        Get the name of the property source. The name should be unique for the type of source, whereas the id is used to ensure unique identity, either locally or remotely.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface PropertySource
        Overrides:
        getName in class BasePropertySource
        Returns:
        the configuration's name, never null.

      • get

        public PropertyValue get(String key)
        Description copied from interface: PropertySource
        Access a property.
        Specified by:
        get in interface PropertySource
        Overrides:
        get in class BasePropertySource
        Parameters:
        key - the property's key, not null.
        Returns:
        the property value map, where map.get(key) == value, including also any metadata. In case a value is null, simply return null.

      • getProperties

        public Map<String,PropertyValue> getProperties()
        Description copied from interface: PropertySource
        Access the current properties as Set. The resulting Map may not return all items accessible, e.g. when the underlying storage does not support iteration of its entries. null
        Returns:
        the corresponding map, never null.

      • isScannable

        public boolean isScannable()
        Description copied from interface: PropertySource
        Determines if this config source can be scanned for its list of properties.

        PropertySources which are not scannable might not be able to find all the configured values to provide via PropertySource.getProperties(). This might happen if the underlying storage doesn't support listing.

        Returns:
        true if this PropertySource can be scanned for its list of properties, false if it cannot/should not be scanned.

      • toStringValues

        protected String toStringValues()
        Overrides:
        toStringValues in class BasePropertySource
